thread.title: BMC Elections 2017: Mumbai witnesses voter turnaround of 52.17%
thread.title_full: BMC Elections 2017: Mumbai witnesses voter turnaround of 52.17% - The Financial Express

author: FE Online
title: BMC Elections 2017: Mumbai witnesses voter turnaround of 52.17%
text:
BMC Polls 2017: Polling for 227 seats of Municipal Corporation of Greater Mumbai continued till 6 pm. (Source: Twitter) Despite regular appeals by the candidates and well-meaning residents of Brihanmumbai to the electorate to cast their votes, the turnout was low but better than the last time. Final turnout was reported at 52.17% when the polling stopped at 6 PM. Even though this is not a new trend and Mumbaikars are known for their apathy, this time over a lot of efforts were made to have a bigger voter turnout. Chief Minister, Devendra Fadnavis made fervent appeals to the residents to come in large numbers and exercise their right to vote.
Udhav Thackeray also made appeals to come and vote, but the residents have kept true to the earlier trend. In 2012, it was 44%. 100 names were also found missing from the voter’s list.For instance, Varun Dhawan, the actor and BJP member, Shaina NC had their names missing from the voter’s list.
Polling for 227 seats of Municipal Corporation of Greater Mumbai continued till 6 pm, where a total of 17,331 candidates are in the fray for 3,210 seats in 10 municipal corporations. The civic body polls witnessed voters from political, Bollywood and sports fraternity.
